segment.source: Create a task sequence with Configuration Manager and MDT (Windows 10)
segment.target: Create a task sequence with Configuration Manager and MDT (Windows 10)

segment.source: In this topic, you will learn how to create a Microsoft System Center 2012 R2 Configuration Manager task sequence with Microsoft Deployment Toolkit (MDT) integration using the MDT wizard.
segment.target: In this topic, you will learn how to create a Microsoft System Center 2012 R2 Configuration Manager task sequence with Microsoft Deployment Toolkit (MDT) integration using the MDT wizard.

segment.source: Create a task sequence with Configuration Manager and MDT
segment.target: Create a task sequence with Configuration Manager and MDT

segment.source: Applies to
segment.target: Applies to

segment.source: Windows 10
segment.target: Windows 10

segment.source: In this topic, you will learn how to create a Microsoft System Center 2012 R2 Configuration Manager task sequence with Microsoft Deployment Toolkit (MDT) integration using the MDT wizard.
segment.target: In this topic, you will learn how to create a Microsoft System Center 2012 R2 Configuration Manager task sequence with Microsoft Deployment Toolkit (MDT) integration using the MDT wizard.

segment.source: Creating task sequences in System Center 2012 R2 Configuration Manager requires many more steps than creating task sequences for MDT Lite Touch installation.
segment.target: Creating task sequences in System Center 2012 R2 Configuration Manager requires many more steps than creating task sequences for MDT Lite Touch installation.

segment.source: Luckily, the MDT wizard helps you through the process and also guides you through creating the needed packages.
segment.target: Luckily, the MDT wizard helps you through the process and also guides you through creating the needed packages.

segment.source: For the purposes of this topic, we will use two machines: DC01 and CM01.
segment.target: For the purposes of this topic, we will use two machines: DC01 and CM01.

segment.source: DC01 is a domain controller and CM01 is a machine running Windows Server 2012 R2 Standard, both of which are members of the domain contoso.com for the fictitious Contoso Corporation.
segment.target: DC01 is a domain controller and CM01 is a machine running Windows Server 2012 R2 Standard, both of which are members of the domain contoso.com for the fictitious Contoso Corporation.

segment.source: For more details on the setup for this topic, please see Deploy Windows 10 with the Microsoft Deployment Toolkit.
segment.target: For more details on the setup for this topic, please see Deploy Windows 10 with the Microsoft Deployment Toolkit.

segment.source: Create a task sequence using the MDT Integration Wizard
segment.target: Create a task sequence using the MDT Integration Wizard

segment.source: This section will walk you through the process of creating a System Center 2012 R2 Configuration Manager task sequence for production use.
segment.target: This section will walk you through the process of creating a System Center 2012 R2 Configuration Manager task sequence for production use.

segment.source: On CM01, using the Configuration Manager Console, in the Software Library workspace, expand Operating Systems, right-click Task Sequences, and select Create MDT Task Sequence.
segment.target: On CM01, using the Configuration Manager Console, in the Software Library workspace, expand Operating Systems, right-click Task Sequences, and select Create MDT Task Sequence.

segment.source: On the Choose Template page, select the Client Task Sequence template and click Next.
segment.target: On the Choose Template page, select the Client Task Sequence template and click Next.

segment.source: On the General page, assign the following settings and then click Next:
segment.target: On the General page, assign the following settings and then click Next:

segment.source: Task sequence name: Windows 10 Enterprise x64 RTM
segment.target: Task sequence name: Windows 10 Enterprise x64 RTM

segment.source: Task sequence comments: Production image with Office 2013
segment.target: Task sequence comments: Production image with Office 2013

segment.source: On the Details page, assign the following settings and then click Next:
segment.target: On the Details page, assign the following settings and then click Next:

segment.source: Join a Domain
segment.target: Join a Domain

segment.source: Domain: contoso.com
segment.target: Domain: contoso.com

segment.source: Account: CONTOSOCMJD
segment.target: Account: CONTOSOCMJD

segment.source: Password: Passw0rd!
segment.target: Password: Passw0rd!

segment.source: Windows Settings
segment.target: Windows Settings

segment.source: User name: Contoso
segment.target: User name: Contoso

segment.source: Organization name: Contoso
segment.target: Organization name: Contoso

segment.source: Product key: blank
segment.target: Product key: blank

segment.source: On the Capture Settings page, accept the default settings, and click Next.
segment.target: On the Capture Settings page, accept the default settings, and click Next.

segment.source: On the Boot Image page, browse and select the Zero Touch WinPE x64 boot image package.
segment.target: On the Boot Image page, browse and select the Zero Touch WinPE x64 boot image package.

segment.source: Then click Next.
segment.target: Then click Next.

segment.source: On the MDT Package page, select Create a new Microsoft Deployment Toolkit Files package, and in the Package source folder to be created (UNC Path): text box, type CM01Sources$OSDMDTMDT 2013.
segment.target: On the MDT Package page, select Create a new Microsoft Deployment Toolkit Files package, and in the Package source folder to be created (UNC Path): text box, type CM01Sources$OSDMDTMDT 2013.

segment.source: Then click Next.
segment.target: Then click Next.

segment.source: On the MDT Details page, assign the name MDT 2013 and click Next.
segment.target: On the MDT Details page, assign the name MDT 2013 and click Next.

segment.source: On the OS Image page, browse and select the Windows 10 Enterprise x64 RTM package.
segment.target: On the OS Image page, browse and select the Windows 10 Enterprise x64 RTM package.

segment.source: Then click Next.
segment.target: Then click Next.

segment.source: On the Deployment Method page, accept the default settings and click Next.
segment.target: On the Deployment Method page, accept the default settings and click Next.

segment.source: On the Client Package page, browse and select the OSD / Configuration Manager Client package.
segment.target: On the Client Package page, browse and select the OSD / Configuration Manager Client package.

segment.source: Then click Next.
segment.target: Then click Next.

segment.source: On the USMT Package page, browse and select the OSD / Microsoft Corporation User State Migration Tool for Windows 8 10.0.10240.16384 package.
segment.target: On the USMT Package page, browse and select the OSD / Microsoft Corporation User State Migration Tool for Windows 8 10.0.10240.16384 package.

segment.source: Then click Next.
segment.target: Then click Next.

segment.source: On the Settings Package page, select the Create a new settings package option, and in the Package source folder to be created (UNC Path): text box, type CM01Sources$OSDSettingsWindows 10 x64 Settings.
segment.target: On the Settings Package page, select the Create a new settings package option, and in the Package source folder to be created (UNC Path): text box, type CM01Sources$OSDSettingsWindows 10 x64 Settings.

segment.source: Then click Next.
segment.target: Then click Next.

segment.source: On the Settings Details page, assign the name Windows 10 x64 Settings and click Next.
segment.target: On the Settings Details page, assign the name Windows 10 x64 Settings and click Next.

segment.source: On the Sysprep Package page, click Next twice.
segment.target: On the Sysprep Package page, click Next twice.

segment.source: On the Confirmation page, click Finish.
segment.target: On the Confirmation page, click Finish.

segment.source: Edit the task sequence
segment.target: Edit the task sequence

segment.source: After you create the task sequence, we recommend that you configure the task sequence for an optimal deployment experience.
segment.target: After you create the task sequence, we recommend that you configure the task sequence for an optimal deployment experience.

segment.source: The configurations include enabling support for Unified Extensible Firmware Interface (UEFI), dynamic organizational unit (OU) allocation, computer replace scenarios, and more.
segment.target: The configurations include enabling support for Unified Extensible Firmware Interface (UEFI), dynamic organizational unit (OU) allocation, computer replace scenarios, and more.

segment.source: On CM01, using the Configuration Manager Console, select Task Sequences, right-click Windows 10 Enterprise x64 RTM task sequence, and select Edit.
segment.target: On CM01, using the Configuration Manager Console, select Task Sequences, right-click Windows 10 Enterprise x64 RTM task sequence, and select Edit.

segment.source: In the Install group, select the Set Variable for Drive Letter action and configure the following:
segment.target: In the Install group, select the Set Variable for Drive Letter action and configure the following:

segment.source: OSDPreserveDriveLetter: True
segment.target: OSDPreserveDriveLetter: True

segment.source: Note
segment.target: Note

segment.source: If you don't change this value, your Windows installation will end up in E:Windows.
segment.target: If you don't change this value, your Windows installation will end up in E:Windows.

segment.source: In the Post Install group, select Apply Network Settings, and configure the Domain OU value to use the Contoso / Workstations OU (browse for values).
segment.target: In the Post Install group, select Apply Network Settings, and configure the Domain OU value to use the Contoso / Workstations OU (browse for values).

segment.source: In the Post Install group, disable the Auto Apply Drivers action.
segment.target: In the Post Install group, disable the Auto Apply Drivers action.

segment.source: (Disabling is done by selecting the action and, in the Options tab, selecting the Disable this step check box.)
segment.target: (Disabling is done by selecting the action and, in the Options tab, selecting the Disable this step check box.)

segment.source: After the disabled Post Install / Auto Apply Drivers action, add a new group name: Drivers.
segment.target: After the disabled Post Install / Auto Apply Drivers action, add a new group name: Drivers.

segment.source: After the Post Install / Drivers group, add an Apply Driver Package action with the following settings:
segment.target: After the Post Install / Drivers group, add an Apply Driver Package action with the following settings:

segment.source: Name: HP EliteBook 8560w
segment.target: Name: HP EliteBook 8560w

segment.source: Driver Package: Windows 10 x64 - HP EliteBook 8560w
segment.target: Driver Package: Windows 10 x64 - HP EliteBook 8560w

segment.source: Options: Task Sequence Variable: Model equals HP EliteBook 8560w
segment.target: Options: Task Sequence Variable: Model equals HP EliteBook 8560w

segment.source: Note
segment.target: Note

segment.source: You also can add a Query WMI condition with the following query: SELECT FROM Win32ComputerSystem WHERE Model LIKE '%HP EliteBook 8560w%'
segment.target: You also can add a Query WMI condition with the following query: SELECT FROM Win32ComputerSystem WHERE Model LIKE '%HP EliteBook 8560w%'

segment.source: figure 24
segment.target: figure 24

segment.source: Figure 24.
segment.target: Figure 24.

segment.source: The driver package options.
segment.target: The driver package options.

segment.source: In the State Restore / Install Applications group, select the Install Application action.
segment.target: In the State Restore / Install Applications group, select the Install Application action.

segment.source: Select the Install the following applications option, and add the OSD / Adobe Reader XI - OSD Install application to the list.
segment.target: Select the Install the following applications option, and add the OSD / Adobe Reader XI - OSD Install application to the list.

segment.source: figure 25
segment.target: figure 25

segment.source: Figure 25.
segment.target: Figure 25.

segment.source: Add an application to the Configuration Manager task sequence.
segment.target: Add an application to the Configuration Manager task sequence.

segment.source: In the State Restore group, after the Set Status 5 action, add a Request State Store action with the following settings:
segment.target: In the State Restore group, after the Set Status 5 action, add a Request State Store action with the following settings:

segment.source: Restore state from another computer
segment.target: Restore state from another computer

segment.source: If computer account fails to connect to state store, use the Network Access account
segment.target: If computer account fails to connect to state store, use the Network Access account

segment.source: Options: Continue on error
segment.target: Options: Continue on error

segment.source: Options / Condition:
segment.target: Options / Condition:

segment.source: Task Sequence Variable
segment.target: Task Sequence Variable

segment.source: USMTLOCAL not equals True
segment.target: USMTLOCAL not equals True

segment.source: In the State Restore group, after the Restore User State action, add a Release State Store action with the following settings:
segment.target: In the State Restore group, after the Restore User State action, add a Release State Store action with the following settings:

segment.source: Options: Continue on error
segment.target: Options: Continue on error

segment.source: Options / Condition:
segment.target: Options / Condition:

segment.source: Task Sequence Variable
segment.target: Task Sequence Variable

segment.source: USMTLOCAL not equals True
segment.target: USMTLOCAL not equals True

segment.source: Click OK.
segment.target: Click OK.

segment.source: Note
segment.target: Note

segment.source: The Request State Store and Release State Store actions need to be added for common computer replace scenarios.
segment.target: The Request State Store and Release State Store actions need to be added for common computer replace scenarios.

segment.source: Move the packages
segment.target: Move the packages

segment.source: While creating the task sequence with the MDT wizard, a few operating system deployment packages were created.
segment.target: While creating the task sequence with the MDT wizard, a few operating system deployment packages were created.

segment.source: To move these packages to the OSD folder, take the following steps.
segment.target: To move these packages to the OSD folder, take the following steps.

segment.source: On CM01, using the Configuration Manager Console, in the Software Library workspace, expand Application Management, and then select Packages.
segment.target: On CM01, using the Configuration Manager Console, in the Software Library workspace, expand Application Management, and then select Packages.

segment.source: Select the MDT 2013 and Windows 10 x64 Settings packages, right-click and select Move.
segment.target: Select the MDT 2013 and Windows 10 x64 Settings packages, right-click and select Move.

segment.source: In the Move Selected Items dialog box, select the OSD folder, and click OK.
segment.target: In the Move Selected Items dialog box, select the OSD folder, and click OK.
